intro: Gigliolia lithophila, commonly known as the Lithophytic Gigliolia, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions in Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its ability to grow on rock surfaces, making it a lithophyte. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces delicate, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is highly sensitive to environmental changes and is considered endangered in its natural range.
